intro.title: Introduction
intro.description1: is a fan-made horror game inspired by Five Nights at Freddy's, reimagining the classic TV series El Chavo del 8 with a dark and unsettling twist.
intro.description2: In this game, familiar characters and locations are transformed into tense, eerie environments that constantly keep players on edge. Survival requires sharp observation, careful listening to audio cues, and strategic management of limited resources as threats escalate. With its atmospheric visuals, suspense-driven sound design, and mobile-optimized controls, Chaves Nightmares delivers a compelling survival horror experience that balances psychological tension with classic jump-scare thrills.

story.title: The Game Story
story.description1: At the heart of Chaves Nightmares lies a chilling, unresolved mystery. Players step into the shoes of a detective tasked with investigating a long-abandoned Chaves-themed venue, the site of a tragic incident that occurred years ago. Each night, survival becomes the immediate concern, while new clues gradually unfold the dark history hidden within the location.
story.description2: The game eschews traditional cutscenes or explicit exposition, instead weaving its story through environmental details, subtle hints, and tense moments of silence. Players uncover the narrative by observing their surroundings, piecing together fragmented information, and interpreting context. This slow-burn approach to storytelling heightens suspense, maintaining a constant sense of tension and uncertainty throughout the experience.

questions.q: Any spoiler-free survival tips to last more nights?
questions.a: If you want to survive longer without spoilers, keep these principles in mind: don't switch camera views constantly out of panic—only switch when you have a reason; establish a fixed rhythm and check key points instead of looking around randomly; and when everything seems 'normal,' that's often when you should be most alert. Each night, ask yourself where your blind spots are, which signal means immediate action, and which action—if repeated too often—will leave you with no escape. In this kind of game, victory comes from discipline, not reflex speed.

questions.q: Does the game have different difficulty levels?
questions.a: Yes. The main nights and Custom Night gradually increase in difficulty, and Custom Night allows you to manually adjust the challenge settings.

questions.q: Is there a time limit or countdown each night?
questions.a: Yes. Each night has a fixed duration, and your goal is to survive until dawn.

questions.q: Are there easter eggs or hidden content?
questions.a: Yes. The game includes hidden items and references to other Chaves-related fan horror games within its extra menus.

questions.q: How does Chaves Nightmares play on mobile?
questions.a: If you enjoy survival horror focused on monitoring and resource management, Chaves Nightmares quickly pulls you in. The core mechanics include watching different areas through cameras or observation points, managing limited resources such as power, time, or actions, and making calm, fast decisions when threats appear—switching views, stopping an action, or waiting instead of panicking. On mobile, the tension is stronger because the screen is close to your face. You're not exploring an open space, but reading signals: a subtle change, a shadow that shouldn't exist, or a sound that arrives half a second late. The game often punishes you right when you think you've mastered its patterns.

questions.q: How is Chaves Nightmares different from other FNaF-style games?
questions.a: Comparisons to Five Nights at Freddy's are inevitable, but the overall experience is noticeably different in three ways. First, it uses the contrast between nostalgia and horror, twisting a once friendly, lighthearted world into something deeply unsettling. Second, it emphasizes psychological horror over action horror, relying less on jump scares and more on anticipation, repetition, doubt, and the uncertainty of whether something just moved. Third, it has a strong fan-made identity: it doesn't aim to be massive in scale, but it feels personal and distinctive, which is why many players find it more authentic.

questions.q: Are the Android system requirements high? Can mid-range phones run it?
questions.a: As a 2D horror game, Chaves Nightmares is generally more hardware-friendly than heavy 3D horror titles, and the requirements are not high. However, stability still depends on the specific build and optimization. For a better experience, close background apps before playing, use headphones—sound acts as a radar, not decoration—and play in a distraction-free environment, as the game punishes loss of focus.

playtips.title: Gameplay Guide
playtips.seotitle: Chaves Nightmares Full Gameplay Guide & Survival Tips
playtips.description: Master Chaves Nightmares with our complete guide. Learn enemy patterns, tool usage, night strategies, and survive all five nights safely.

objective.title: Objective
objective.description: The primary goal of Chaves Nightmares is to survive each night until morning by correctly identifying and responding to threats. Survival depends on observation, timely action, and proper use of tools.
objective.li1: Survive until morning – Nights end automatically at 8:00 a.m.; all actions focus on lasting until dawn.
objective.li2: Track enemy movements – Cameras and audio cues provide early warnings.
objective.li3: Identify active enemies – Each character behaves differently and requires specific responses.
objective.li4: Use tools correctly – Flashlight, items, audio, and phone panel each serve a defined purpose.
objective.li5: Handle increasing difficulty – Nights 3–5 introduce multiple simultaneous threats.

core_loop.title: Core Gameplay Loop
core_loop.li1: Monitor cameras – Regularly check all areas to track movement and detect early visual cues.
core_loop.li2: Identify active enemies – Determine exactly which character is approaching before acting.
core_loop.li3: Apply the correct countermeasure – Use the appropriate item, system, or interaction.
core_loop.li4: Manage resources – Conserve flashlight battery and keep items prepared for critical moments.
core_loop.li5: Repeat until morning – The loop persists, with threats intensifying each night.

row1.name: Chavo del Ocho
row1.behavior: Sensitive to light; main recurring threat
row1.handle: Use flashlight sparingly; prolonged or panic flashing increases aggression.

row2.name: Kiko
row2.handle: Apply talcum powder immediately; delay often results in unavoidable attack.

row3.name: Doña Florinda
row3.behavior: Becomes hostile if ignored; reacts to audio
row3.handle: Trigger audio system at correct timing; mistimed activation is ineffective.

row4.name: Don Ramón
row4.handle: Use phone panel to call Don Barriga immediately; delayed response causes instant death.

row5.name: La Chilindrina
row5.handle: Give lollipop before she reaches close range; late usage fails.

row6.name: Profesor Jirafales
row6.handle: Keep coffee ready; use immediately once he is active.

row7.name: La Bruja del 71
row7.behavior: Leaves broom visible briefly before attack
row7.handle: Click broom instantly to force retreat; missing cue is fatal.

row8.name: Jaimito (Night 5 Only)
row8.behavior: Appears only on final night with unique mechanic
row8.handle: Press and hold mailbag until he leaves; releasing early triggers attack.

enemy_patterns.title: 8 Enemy Behavior Patterns (Detailed)
enemy_patterns.li1: Direct approach – Enemies move straight to the office; counter with the assigned item immediately (Don Ramón, Kiko).
enemy_patterns.li2: Stealth approach – Enemies appear slowly or quietly; monitor cameras to detect early movement (La Chilindrina).
enemy_patterns.li3: Visual cue triggered – Enemy attack is indicated by a brief object or light signal (La Bruja del 71 broom).
enemy_patterns.li4: Audio-triggered response – Requires using sound or audio system at precise timing (Doña Florinda).
enemy_patterns.li5: Light-sensitive aggression – Flashlight overuse increases enemy speed or aggression (Chavo del Ocho).
enemy_patterns.li6: Continuous presence threat – Enemy stays active in a specific zone and reacts if ignored (Profesor Jirafales).
enemy_patterns.li7: Sudden activation – Appears unexpectedly with minimal warning; quick item response required (Kiko).
enemy_patterns.li8: Special night mechanic – Appears only in a specific night with unique interaction (Jaimito mailbag on Night 5).

tools.title: Tools & Systems (Detailed)
tools.li1: Flashlight – Reveals enemies but drains battery and increases Chavo’s aggression. Use briefly for identification; avoid panic flashing.
tools.li2: Security Cameras – Track all areas and detect short visual cues; develop a consistent loop for scanning.
tools.li3: Audio System – Calms certain characters (Doña Florinda). Activate only at the correct moment; may malfunction on later nights.
tools.li4: Talcum Powder – Repels Kiko; use immediately upon appearance; cannot be reused until next night.
tools.li5: Lollipop – Distracts La Chilindrina; give before she approaches too closely.
tools.li6: Phone Panel – Calls Don Barriga to stop Don Ramón; must be used immediately.
tools.li7: Coffee – Calms Profesor Jirafales; prepare in advance and apply when active.

controls.title: Control & Interaction Methods
controls.pc_cameras: Cameras: Click or hover to switch views.
controls.pc_items: Items: Drag-and-drop to target character or click hotkeys.
controls.pc_audio: Audio system: Click panel buttons at correct timing.
controls.pc_phone: Phone panel: Click buttons to call Don Barriga.
controls.mobile_items: Items: Drag or tap to apply.
controls.mobile_audio: Audio system: Tap to activate at correct moment.
controls.mobile_phone: Phone panel: Tap to call Don Barriga.
controls.mobile_mailbag: Mailbag (Night 5): Tap and hold until Jaimito leaves.

night1.title: Night 1 – Basic Training
night1.focus: Learn camera layout and basic movement cues.
night1.tips: Avoid overusing flashlight; establish consistent camera-check routine.

night2.title: Night 2 – Reaction Training
night2.focus: Introduce item usage and character-specific countermeasures.
night2.tips: Keep talcum powder and phone panel ready; act immediately upon threat recognition.

night3.title: Night 3 – Multitasking Begins
night3.focus: Manage multiple threats simultaneously; begin structured camera-check routines.
night3.tips: Prioritize fast-moving threats; prepare items in advance; avoid focusing on a single camera too long.

night4.title: Night 4 – Visual Cue Awareness
night4.threats: La Chilindrina, Profesor Jirafales, La Bruja del 71
night4.focus: Detect brief visual cues while handling other enemies.
night4.tips: Scan cameras carefully; keep lollipop and coffee ready; anticipate overlapping attacks.

night5.title: Night 5 – Full Mechanic Mastery
night5.tips: Detect broom instantly; respond to Don Ramón without delay; control flashlight usage carefully; hold Jaimito’s mailbag until departure.

survival.title: Important Survival Principles
survival.li1: Conserve flashlight usage; unnecessary use increases threat levels.
survival.li2: Monitor visual cues continuously; brief lapses can be fatal.
survival.li3: Prepare items before enemies arrive; do not search during emergencies.
survival.li4: Maintain a consistent camera-checking routine; predictability reduces mistakes.
survival.li5: React immediately; hesitation is more dangerous than incorrect input.

story.title: Story Outcome
story.description: After surviving all five nights, the investigation confirms Chavo del Ocho as the cause of the deadly incidents. Story information is revealed through gameplay and environmental clues rather than cutscenes.

page12.title1: Overview of Five Nights at Freddy's
page12.content1-1: Five Nights at Freddy's (FNAF) is a survival horror game series created by Scott Cawthon. The game’s tension is built through limited visibility, audio cues, and time-based events.
page12.content1-2: FNAF has become a cultural phenomenon online, inspiring numerous fan games, videos, and forums discussing strategies and lore. Its simple yet suspenseful mechanics have made it widely accessible while maintaining a strong horror atmosphere.
page12.content2-1: Chaves Nightmares draws direct inspiration from FNAF’s core survival mechanics. Players move through different areas to investigate a series of events, blending survival horror with detective-style gameplay.
page12.content2-2: Although the tension-building methods are reminiscent of FNAF, Chaves Nightmares adds its own narrative structure, story progression, and environmental puzzles. The concept of surviving consecutive nights remains, but players have more agency in how they uncover clues and respond to threats.
